newsitem.title: USA: Portland Genl shareholders okay Enron merger.
newsitem.headline: Portland Genl shareholders okay Enron merger.

text.p: Portland General Corp said Tuesday its shareholders approved plans to merge the utility holding company with Enron Corp in a $2.1 billion stock swap transaction.
The vote marks the final chapter in a process that began a year ago, when Houston-based natural gas giant Enron announced plans to acquire the parent of Portland General Electric Co.
The deal was hailed as a milestone in the transition of the U.S. natural gas and electricity industries into competitive mareketplaces with nationwide scope.

Earlier this month, the Oregon Public Utility Commission (OPUC) lifted its opposition to the merger after Enron agreed to grant $141 million in customer rate reductions as well as meet other conditions set by the regulatory agency.
The companies plan to file within 60 days of the merger's completion a plan to open the utility's Oregon service territory to competition.

To pay for the rate cuts, the companies lowered the share exchange ratio of the deal to 0.9825 shares of Enron stock for every share of Portland General stock, compared with the previous one-for-one ratio.
Portland General said 97 percent of stockholders voting approved the new merger terms.
Portland's shares closed down 3/4 at 38-1/2 Tuesday and Enron shares were down 5/8 at 39-1/4.
